data.title: No One Knows Exactly How Many People Are Dying From Extreme Heat
data.meta_description: Rising temperatures are killing a growing number of people around the world. Academics, doctors and government officials are struggling to keep track.
data.text:
When officials in Miami-Dade County wanted to figure out how many people there were dying from extreme heat, they turned to Christopher Ueijo.

A geographer at Florida State University, Ueijo used temperature data and death records to determine that, between 2015 and 2019, heat killed an average of 34 people a year in the county who wouldnâ€™t have died otherwise. His estimate was more than 10 times higher than the official figures: Over the same time period, Miami-Dade had classified just two deaths as heat-related.
